## Darwin: Evolution as descent with modification
<hr>

* **<span style="color:blue">Descent with modification</span> was Darwin's theory on how the Tree of Life was created**

<br/>

* **Darwin  accounted for extinction and inheritance but did not know about genes or DNA**

<br/>

* **The mechanism proposed by Darwin was different from Lamarck**

## Mechanism of Darwinian Evolution
<hr>

<div align="center">
* **Focus on <span style="color:blue">adaptation</span> through natural selection (not use/disuse)**
    + characteristics that enhance fitness
    + these characteristics are heritable
<br/>
* **Different populations of organisms live in different habitats, so they gradually accumulate changes to be better suited to that habitat (<span style="color:blue">adaptation</span>)**

<br/>

**?Could new species arise from an *ancestral form* by <span style="color:blue">adaptations to different environments?</span>**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:390px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:900px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/beak.png">

## Evolution by natural selection rules (1)
<hr>

<div align="center">

**(1) Individuals in a population vary in their traits**

<br/>
**trait is an observable and measurable characteristic of an organism phenotype**

<br/>
**<span style="color:blue">Trait variation comes from random mutations</span>**
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:350px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/butterflywings.jpg">

## Evolution by natural selection rules (2)
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div align="center">
**(2) Some of these differences are heritable**

<br/>


</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:325px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/heritable.png">

## Evolution by natural selection rules (3)
<hr>

<div align="center">
**(3) In each generation, many more offspring are produced than can survive**

<br/>

* **Only some will survive to reproduce**
<br/>
* **Some will produce more offspring than others**
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:350px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/survival.png">

## Evolution by natural selection rules (4)
<hr>

<div align="center">

**(4) Individuals with certain heritable traits are more likely to survive and reproduce (<span style="color:blue">adaptation</span>)**

<br/>

* **Individuals with certain traits produce more offspring than those without those traits (<span style="color:blue">selection</span>)**
<br/>
* **<span style="color:blue">Individuals are selected naturally, by the environment</span>**
<br/>
* **Favorable traits will accumulate in a population**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:350px; LEFT:350px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/butterflywings2.jpg">

## Natural Selection acts on individuals but populations evolve
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Droughts cause shifts in beaks of finches on the Galapagos Islands**
    + selection pressures from food availability (seeds) changed as certain plants suffered from drought

<br/>

* **Average beak depth increases over time because deep-beaked individuals had greater reproductive success**
    + <span style="color:darkred">*the individuals during drought did not adapt beak size!*</span>

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:180px; LEFT:575px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/beakdepth.png">

## Modern history of the evolution of antibiotic resistance 
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Penicillin used in 1943 to stop *S.aureus* **
    + by 1945 20% of *S.aureus* resistant
    + due to new enzyme 'penicilinase"

<br/>

* **Methicillin used in 1959 to stop *S.aureus* **
    + deactivates production of cell walls
    + resistant strains emerged within 2 years
    + evolved  a different enzyme to make cell walls

<br/>

* **Natural selection then lead to spread of MRSA**
    + Methicillin-resistant *S.aureus* super bugs!
    + MRSA now resistant to multiple antibiotics
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:575px; WIDTH:425px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/mrsa2.jpg">

## Antibiotic resistance is not new to evolution!
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/cave.jpg">

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **Antibiotic resistance is ancient and widespread**
    + genes to protect against penicillin, tetracycline, etc.
    + soil bacteria are rich in resistance 

<br/>

* **Multi-drug resistance found in bacteria isolated from Lechuguilla Cave**
    + ecosystem isolated from surface for 4 million years
    + *Paenibacillus* cave isolate is resistant to most clinical antibiotics
    + 18 resistance mechanisms, including 3 unknown!

    
</div>
